name: Haven Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night here on road trip to Scotland. Good location to town. Parking outside. Very, very clean. Comfortable room with all requirements. Proprietor was extremely welcoming and helpful. Breakfast was great with quality local produce. We both enjoyed our stay and would thoroughly recommend.
reviews.title: Recommended Guest House. Very comfortable, clean and welcoming. Excellent breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in room 5, in the attic (wife not too pleased about that), sea views and very clean. Room size was ok, shower room decent size. Would definitely consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Very nice couple of days in Whitby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was first attracted to this B&B because of the location. It sits on a charming cresent with other victorian houses. Our stay was very enjoyable. Stevie and Chris were very helpful and really made us feel at home. Their attention to details made for a very nice atmosphere. Breakfast was lovely. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. We stayed in Room 5 which had a sea view and was decorated perfectly. The en suite was well laid out and not cramped at all. We look forward to another visit in the future!
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from yet another stay at the Haven. We opted to stay in room 2 with fantastic sea views and as usual the same level of cleanliness. However are standards slipping a little!!!!.
reviews.title: Are standards slipping !!!!

reviews.text: Our 4 poster bedroom was probably the smallest room we had stayed in and was very cramped to say the least!
reviews.title: Exellent

reviews.text: An ideal location with lovely views. This guest house is immaculate, friendly, comfortable and is ideal for couples or the single traveller.
reviews.title: A truly superb and comfortable guest house

reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent too.
reviews.title: Perfect base for Folk Week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 10/10 all round.
reviews.title: Probably the best B&B we have ever stayed in.

reviews.text: Thank you :-)
reviews.title: Ninth year of returning to this hotel.
"THE HAVEN GUEST HOUSE" Still The Best.
reviews.text: I can't praise The Haven too highly - beautifully decorated, immaculately clean, and a HUGE breakfast to set you up for the rest of the day! This handsome Victorian house enjoys spectacular views across the harbour and is only about five minutes walk away from the town centre. The proprieters and staff go out of their way to ensure that guests want for nothing. I returned from my eight-night stay yesterday and have already booked my room for the 2012 Folk Week!

Stayed here for three nights for the 60's weekend. This guesthouse is immaculately clean and the breakfasts are very good.For those who complain about room sizes this is a guesthouse not a hotel if you want that type of accommodation with larger but non-descript rooms book one of them. The owner and staff all very pleasant ,all in all a very nice place too stay.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful quiet location, close to waterfront and upper bluff shopping streets. Whitby is small and picturesque, and actually everything was walking distance. No WiFi here, so went down to the local pub for that. (you might be able to pick it up for free from one of the Haven's neighbors...)We were given room 1, and it has the same sea views as the pricier 4 poster in room 2 with a larger bathroom and shower, but know that the room 1 shower is tiny, and you have to walk sideways around the bed cause the room is so small. Parking is the wild card. Don't pay for it, but rather, scout for open spots in front or nearby the hotel, on the street. Then move your car closer. Rules are 'you must only sit at your assigned table for breakfast' (room 2 has the table by the only window). Paypal takes credit cards, but the balance for more outstanding nights must be paid in cash only. 'No takeaway food in the rooms'. That said, the room was spotless,(recommend losing the teddy bear) the breakfast was ample, if salty, and I would recommend staying here again in a different larger room.
reviews.title: Great location, lots of rules

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights from 3rd Sept 2011 in room 6. The room was very nice and quite spacious. The welcome we recieved was very good and the staff were very pleasant. The breakfast was good and set us up nicely for all the walking we did around Whitby and the surrounding area. We would highly recommend a stay here and we will definately return on our next visit to Whitby.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 2 with a four poster bed and sea views. It was a fantastic clean room. Everyone was friendly. Breakfast was lovely and plenty of it. We were made very welcome. We would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I stayed here in a single room over the weekend and can not fault it - it was a perfect stay. It is located just seconds from the main pier/beach but above on a headland allowing for amazing views and a quiet, tranquil location. The place is spotless and rooms are comfortable. The breakfast is delicious and is served with a smile. Overall service was excellent- everyone is so friendly. I'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: Can't fault it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every year we return to the same place so I feel The Haven deserves a special mention. Looking for other places to stop in Whitby is something we have not done in a very long time. All the rooms are excellent and incredibly clean! The cleanest guest house i have known. The breakfasts we always look forward to and you will definetely not go hungry. We are always well looked after and the staff make sure of it. The look and feel of the place as soon as you walk into The Haven is warm and friendly and for us it now feels like a home from home. Anything more we have needed we only had to ask and the kind helpful response is always there. You can see the hard work that goes into The Haven and it is truly worth every penny. Looking forward to our next visits!
reviews.title: Everything you should expect from a Guest House!

reviews.text: Cleanest B&B i have visited, hosts are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble, Great breakfast, superb views.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed during Regatta weekend and was very pleased and surprised at how clean (imaculate) the whole guest house was. We stayed in room 5 which was on the top floor, and was an average size, the ensuite had lovely fresh white towels and lots of toiletries. Breakfast was brilliant with locally sourced products, and amazing service, and the view over the harbour is beautiful. Overall without a doubt a perfect B & B in a picturesque yorkshire harbour town, a fantastic weekend break and a must for anyone who hasnt been before.
reviews.title: Cleanest, friendliest, and well run B & B we have stayed in with excellent Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend this guest house, we have stayed here twice now and it never disappoints. The rooms are spotless and the beds lovely and comfy - have stayed in one of the 4 poster rooms and more recently in rm 6 - both excellent. Breakfast is very nice , made with local produce. The lady owner is lovely and friendly.
reviews.title: Will be recommending this to family and friends, and would definitely go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Haven B&B this last weekend (5th/8th) for three night's.
reviews.title: Brilliant Weekend

description: Small luxury guest house on the west cliff at Whitby, managed by the owners Chris & Stevie Connell. Close to all amenities. King size fourposter beds & sea views, all rooms ensuite, Memory foam mattresses on some beds, WiFi available, welcome trays and flat screen TVs in every room, full English breakfast included. We pride ourselves on the cleanliness of our guest house.
